name.value: Admission Method NHS Data Model and Dictionary

description.value: A set of codes representing the method of admission of a patient to a clinical setting, using the values listed in the NHS Data Model and Dictionary definition for Admission Method.

display.value: Accident and emergency or dental casualty department of the Health Care Provider
General Practitioner: after a request for immediate admission has been made direct to a Hospital Provider, i.e. not through a Bed bureau, by a General Practitioner or deputy
Consultant Clinic, of this or another Health Care Provider
Admission via Mental Health Crisis Resolution Team
Accident and Emergency Department of another provider where the Patient had not been admitted
Transfer of an admitted Patient from another Hospital Provider in an emergency
Baby born at home as intended

definition.value: Examples are: admitted from the Accident and Emergency Department of another provider where they had not been admitted, transfer of an admitted Patient from another Hospital Provider in an emergency, or baby born at home as intended

display.value: The birth of a baby in this Health Care Provider
Baby born outside the Health Care Provider except when born at home as intended.
Transfer of any admitted Patient from other Hospital Provider other than in an emergency
